# Information

On the **15th Feb. 2019 **I helped in the organization of the event [**Eyes on Mars** (_Occhi su Marte_ ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹)](https://matematicafisica.uniroma3.it/terza-missione/iniziative-per-tutti/occhi-su-marte/), at the [department of Mathematics and Physics](https://matematicafisica.uniroma3.it/) of the [Roma Tre University](https://www.uniroma3.it/).

The event consisted in a series of seminars, presentation, hands-on activities for kids and observations with the telescope. 
The even had a broad scope for the general audience, covering several talks and activities about science in general.

I contributed to the organization of the whole event and presented myself a demonstration of the [Barkhausen effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barkhausen_effect), which provides a macroscopic evidence of the formation of Weiss domains in ferromagnetic materials.

In my presentation with title [**Electromagnetic...  Attractions** (_Attrazioniâ€¦ elettromagnetiche_ ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹)](https://matematicafisica.uniroma3.it/terza-missione/iniziative-per-tutti/occhi-su-marte/#:~:text=Attrazioni%E2%80%A6%20elettromagnetiche),
I used a transformer connected to a loudspeaker and a magnet.
Passing the magnet next to the metal surrounding the transformer me and [Alessio Rettaroli](https://inspirehep.net/authors/1874381) were able to reproduce in the loudspeaker the typical clicking noise of Weiss domains flip.
